articles.content:
WHO experts on Thursday criticized the sluggish pace of Europe's vaccine rollout and said a surge in coronavirus infections was "worrying."

articles.description: The World Health Organization has warned that Europe's COVID surge is "more worrying than it has been in months. It also said the European Union's vaccine rollout had been "unacceptably slow."
articles.title: WHO slams Europe's 'unacceptably slow' vaccine rollout - Deutsche Welle

articles.author: Holly Ellyatt
articles.content: LONDON There are signs that Europe's diverging and changing usage rules when it comes to the coronavirus vaccine developed by AstraZeneca and the University of Oxford are sowing further confusion and… [+4198 chars]
articles.description: There are signs that Europe's diverging — and changing — usage rules when it comes to AstraZeneca's Covid vaccine are sowing further confusion among citizens.
articles.title: 'Everyone here is confused': Europe's see-sawing over AstraZeneca's vaccine is stoking uncertainty - CNBC

articles.title: Europe vaccine rollout 'unacceptably slow', case surge 'worrying': WHO - Manila Bulletin

articles.content: John le Carré, the British novelist who cast flawed spies onto the bleak chessboard of Cold War rivalry, was so disillusioned by the 2016 Brexit vote to leave the European Union that he secured Irish… [+1361 chars]
articles.description: John le Carré, the British novelist who cast flawed spies onto the bleak chessboard of Cold War rivalry, was so disillusioned by the 2016 Brexit vote to leave the European Union that he secured Irish citizenship shortly before he died.
articles.title: Le Carré got Irish citizenship following Brexit vote - RTE.ie
